reviews.review_msg: The lectures are actually pretty good. Just don't discredit the complaints on here as being only from idiots who always fail. I assumed that, and took her anyway. I have serious regrets. Marks are 2 full grades lower than my usual, with full effort. Attempts to understand why and improve are met with disrespect bordering on abusive and cruel. Why?

Aw, c'mon now, Shapiro is hilarious.  I laughed a lot in her course.  I just wouldn't recommend her if you used to being snuggled through difficult problems.  Grow a backbone and really squeeze your mind grapes and it's an easy C.  Just kidding.  (Not really).

There's layers and layers to everything this guy says. His arguments are original compelling at the surface level, but he is also often making literary illusions and puns. Witty, kind, definitely a genius. BUT you will feel unsure what is expected of you and have to be innovative and take major academic risks. He might also forget to grade your pap
I took one 200 and one 300 level course with her.  If I had the opportunity to take more courses with her, I definitely would have.

Phil of language. Good course. The readings are interesting and clear and Hahn is ok as a lecturer. BUT, comments on papers are extremely rude if you get any at all, even if you get a decent grade! Ask anyone: doesn't read the finals at all, just randomly guesses at a mark. Then is "away" until next semester. You wont learn how to improve at all.

I would give a better rating except I think his marking criteria is vague and he does not communicate well in regards to what he expects from students in their papers. His lectures make his expertise obvious, but his pedagogical skills need some work. Overall, he is approachable and helpful when you want to talk during office hours.
